org.wikidata.wdtk.client

Class DumpProcessingOutputAction

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.wikidata.wdtk.client.DumpProcessingOutputAction
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DumpProcessingAction, EntityDocumentDumpProcessor, EntityDocumentProcessor
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    JsonSerializationAction, RdfSerializationAction

    public abstract class DumpProcessingOutputAction
extends Object
implements DumpProcessingAction
    Abstract implementation of DumpProcessingAction that represents actions which generate outputs (in the form of files). It supports options OPTION_DESTINATION, OPTION_COMPRESSION, and OPTION_USE_STDOUT. Moreover, it provides some static helper functions for opening files for writing.
    Author:
    Michael GÃ¼nther, Markus Kroetzsch

      protected String outputDestination
      For operations that generate output, this is the name of the output file, or null to use the default file name for the given options.

      String name of the site that the processed dump file comes from.
      protected Sites sites
      The Sites object if provided.
      protected boolean useStdOut
      Specifies if output should be redirected to stdout rather than being written to a file.

    • Field Detail

      • OPTION_COMPRESSION

        public static final String OPTION_COMPRESSION
        Name of the option used to define that output be compressed in a particular way. By default, output is not compressed. When using compression, the output file will be extended with a suitable file extension.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • OPTION_DESTINATION

        public static final String OPTION_DESTINATION
        Name of the option to set the destination file name (may include path) for outputs generated by this action. If not given, actions should pick a default output file.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • OPTION_USE_STDOUT

        public static final String OPTION_USE_STDOUT
        Name of the option to redirect output to stdout. This is achieved by setting the value to the string "true". Other values are ignored.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • setSites

        public void setSites(Sites sites)
        Description copied from interface: DumpProcessingAction
        Sets the sites information to the given value. The method DumpProcessingAction.needsSites() is used to find out if this is actually needed.
        Specified by:
        setSites in interface DumpProcessingAction
        Parameters:
        sites - the sites information for the data that will be processed

      • setOption

        public boolean setOption(String option,
                String value)
        Description copied from interface: DumpProcessingAction
        Sets the options of the specified name to the given value. Returns true if the option was known, and false otherwise. Implementation should overwrite this function to support additional options.
        Specified by:
        setOption in interface DumpProcessingAction
        Parameters:
        option - name of the option to be set
        value - the new value of the option
        Returns:
        true if the option was known (no matter if the given value could actually be used or not)

      • useStdOut

        public boolean useStdOut()
        Description copied from interface: DumpProcessingAction
        Returns true if this action will write results (not log messages) to stdout. The default implementation returns true if no other output destination has been specified. Subclasses that do not write results to stdout in this case should overwrite this method.
        Specified by:
        useStdOut in interface DumpProcessingAction
        Returns:
        true if the action is configured to write results to stdout

      • setDumpInformation

        public void setDumpInformation(String project,
                      String dateStamp)
        Description copied from interface: DumpProcessingAction
        Provides the action with general information about the dump that is to be processed. This may be used, e.g., to define file names to use for the output.
        Specified by:
        setDumpInformation in interface DumpProcessingAction
        Parameters:
        project - the name of the project that the dump is from
        dateStamp - the datestamp (YYYYMMDD) for the dump

      • insertDumpInformation

        public String insertDumpInformation(String pattern)

      • getOutputStream

        protected static OutputStream getOutputStream(boolean useStdOut,
                           String filePath,
                           String compressionType)
                                       throws IOException
        Creates an compressing OutputStream.
        Parameters:
        useStdOut - if true, System.out is returned and the other parameters are ignored
        filePath - the string name of the output file, possibly including path information
        compressionType - a string that refers to a type of output compression or the empty string (no compression); a suitable file extension will be added to the output file
        Returns:
        compressing OutputStream
        Throws:
        IOException - if there were problems opening the required streams

      • getAsynchronousOutputStream

        protected static OutputStream getAsynchronousOutputStream(OutputStream outputStream)
                                                   throws IOException
        Creates a separate thread for writing into the given output stream and returns a pipe output stream that can be used to pass data to this thread.

        This code is inspired by http://stackoverflow.com/questions/12532073/gzipoutputstream -that-does-its-compression-in-a-separate-thread

        Parameters:
        outputStream - the stream to write to in the thread
        Returns:
        a new stream that data should be written to
        Throws:
        IOException - if the pipes could not be created for some reason
